name: stix
label: STIX
description:
Structured Threat Information Expression, is a language and serialization format for exchanging threat information in cyberspace. Using this connector we can be used to extract indicators from the submitted STIX file and also export selected indicators from FortiSOAR in a valid STIX specification.

This connector has a dependency on the Threat Intel Management Solution Pack.

fields.title: STIX Specification Version
fields.name: spec_version
fields.description: Select the STIX specification file version that you want to use to perform automated operations. You can choose between versions 2.1 (default) or 2.0.

operations.title: Extract Indicators From STIX File
operations.description: Extracts indicators from the submitted STIX file by specifying either the STIX2 File IRI or the name of the STIX file and other input parameters you have specified. This operation supports files submitted as per STIX specification 2.0 or 2.1.

parameters.title: STIX2 File IRI or Name
parameters.name: file_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IRI or the name of the file that contains the input in the STIX2 format.
parameters.description: Specify the IRI or the name of the file that contains the input in the STIX2 format. If the file is uploaded to FortiSOAR, then you can specify the IRI of the file, else you can specify the name of the file uploaded to the /tmp folder on the server.

parameters.title: Process Response As
parameters.name: output_mode
options: Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR
parameters.value: Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR
parameters.tooltip: The Feed Data can either be returned as a JSON; written to a file on the FortiSOAR server; or Created as Feed Records in FortiSOAR
parameters.description: Select the method for processing the response of this operation. You can choose to return the data as a JSON (Return as a JSON), write it to a file on the FortiSOAR server (Save to File), or create it as feed records in FortiSOAR (Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR). If you choose the 'Save to File' option, then in the Filename field specify the name of the file to be created on the FortiSOAR server. The file will be created in the /tmp folder on the server. If you choose the 'Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR' option, then in the Record Creation Playbook IRI or UUID field specify the IRI or UUID of the playbook that will create the feed records in FortiSOAR.

parameters.title: Confidence
parameters.name: confidence
parameters.tooltip: Specify the confidence score to be set by default for the feeds returned by this operation. By default, this is set as 50
parameters.description: Specify the confidence score to be set by default for the feeds returned by this operation. By default, this is set as 50.

parameters.title: Reputation
parameters.name: reputation
parameters.tooltip: Select the reputation to be set by default for the feeds returned by this operation. You can choose between Good, Suspicious (default), Malicious, No Reputation Available, or TBD.
parameters.description: Select the reputation to be set by default for the feeds returned by this operation. You can choose between Good, Suspicious (default), Malicious, No Reputation Available, or TBD.

parameters.title: TLP
parameters.name: tlp
parameters.tooltip: Select the TLP to be set by default for the feeds returned by this operation. You can choose between Red, Amber (default), Green, or White
parameters.description: Select the TLP to be set by default for the feeds returned by this operation. You can choose between Red, Amber (default), Green, or White.

parameters.title: Maximum Age (in Days)
parameters.name: expiry
parameters.tooltip: Specify the age (in days) to be set by default for the feeds returned by this operation. By default, this is set as 90. The indicator expires on the valid_until date unless a different expiry is specified. If an expiry is specified, then the indicator will be marked expired on valid_from + expiry
parameters.description: Specify the age (in days) to be set by default for the feeds returned by this operation. By default, this is set as 90. The indicator expires on the valid_until date unless a different expiry is specified. If an expiry is specified, then the indicator will be marked expired on valid_from + expiry.

operations.title: Export Indicators In STIX Spec Format
operations.description: Exports selected indicators from FortiSOAR in a valid STIX spec, which can then be downloaded as a STIX file based on the FortiSOAR Indicator list and other input parameters you have specified. This operation supports files submitted as per STIX specification 2.0 or 2.1.

parameters.title: FortiSOAR Indicator List
parameters.name: indicator_list
parameters.tooltip: Specify a list of FortiSOAR indicators in the JSON format that you want to export in the STIX specifications format
parameters.description: Specify a list of FortiSOAR indicators in the JSON format that you want to export in the STIX specifications format.

parameters.title: Traffic Light Protocol Level
parameters.name: tlp
parameters.tooltip: Select the TLP to be set by default for the observables (feeds) that you want to export in the STIX specifications format. You can choose between Red, Amber (default), Green, or White
parameters.description: Select the TLP to be set by default for the observables (feeds) that you want to export in the STIX specifications format. You can choose between Red, Amber (default), Green, or White.

parameters.name: file_response

parameters.tooltip: Select this option to write the exported indicators to a file on the FortiSOAR server based on the filename you have specified, else the indicators will be returned as a JSON
parameters.description: Select this option to write the exported indicators to a file on the FortiSOAR server based on the filename you have specified, else the indicators will be returned as a JSON. If you select the 'Save Response to File' checkbox, then in the Filename field, specify the name of the file to be created on the FortiSOAR server. The file will contain the exported indicators and will be created in the /tmp folder on the server.
